content:
Posted: July 3, 2015
												This is a game. About pirate ships. That fly. And have large missile launchers, flamethrowers and a large assortment of other weapons. And you can shoot those. At other flying pirate ships. If that doesn't sound good to you, you clearly had no childhood.The idea of this game is to use your ariship to shoot down other airships. The core concept is very simple, and doesn't require Counter-Strike levels of aiming skill. However, don't let that fool you into thinking this game requires no skill. You still need to coordinate and compensate for movement on guns. The guns aren't hitscan like CS, which means you must compensate for projectile movement and lead your targets.There are 3 different roles:Pilot: Pilots the ship. Duh. Has several abilities to change ship functions, such as adding speed. Most of these damage some ship component.Engineer: Fixes anything that breaks/explodes. Can use fire extinguishers, and wield more than one repair tool. You can have 3 at one time, allowing you to adapt your fixing method depending on how many parts have exploded/lit on fire.Gunner: Holds different types of ammo that allows him to adapt to different situations. Need more fire? Got it. Need faster bullets? Sure!Each of these roles must work together in a crew of four to destroy enemy ships. The built in voice chat is excellent, providing you a great way to work together with teammates. If you don't have a mic, don't play this game. You won't enjoy it. The teamwork itself is quite satisfying(10 DEGREES TO PORT, CAPN! GET THAT HULL BACK UP, ENGIE!), and this is the part of the game that I enjoy the most. The multiplayer has a commendation system built in, as well as a report system. Most of the community is very friendly, and the salty ones get weeded out quickly.As for the variety, everything is unlocked from the start, meaning you can use every ship in the game(provided you're willing to get wrecked your first few games with large ships). Every gun on these ships is replaceable, allowing you to create your own loadouts suited for every situation. Sniper? Sure. Close range bruiser? You got it. Each crew member has a custom loadout that can be edited from the start as well.New to the game? Don't worry, there's a specific section of muiltiplayer dedicated to level 10 or below players. This limits the ships you can use to some simpler ones to get you used to the game. If you like, you can skip right into regular matchmaking.I highly recommend this game. The devs are great and still provide quality updates. I have no clue why people say this game is dead, there are 3K plus players online at any time. Filling lobbies is easy, getting everyone to ready up is the hard part. :P

Posted: June 8, 2016
Product received for free
												Do you like working in a team? Do you like chaotic situations? Do you like shooting down airships? If you answered yes to any of these questions, you'll probably like Guns of Icarus Online. Piloting a ship requires close coordination between the pilot, engineers, and gunners to make sure you can down other ships without being destroyed yourselves. Communication with other ships on your team is vital. Matches usually go one of two ways: someone isn't listening and it all falls apart, or everyone works together and beautiful things happen. Winning in Guns of Icarus requires both skill and teamwork—and that's why I love it.(Note: I recieved this game as a gift from a friend, so I checked the "recieved this for free" box. I have had no direct contact with the developers, and this review is my opinion alone.)(P.S. If this review motivated you to purchase Guns of Icarus (or you just want a code to enter), use my referral code nPv5xw so we can both get some gifts ingame! Just click the Community button in the top left, then click Review and Recruit in the bottom right. You only have 30 days to enter a code from account creation, so make sure you enter someone's code.)

Posted: March 23, 2016
												Guns of Icarus is a challenging team deathmatch/capture the flag strategy game themed around steampunk zeplin warfare. Each player chooses a class to play as (captain, engineer, or gunner) and that player works together with their 4-man crew and other ally ships to defeat enemy ships. I've played this game for 2 years now and go through phases with this game. I always get excited to play it again but when I do somebody always ruins the experience and I decide not to play again for another few months. I've also noticed that this game is very popular in north-western countries like England, Scotland, and Ireland (about 75% of people on your server are probably European...not sure exactly why that is, but it's neat). This game is heavily communication oriented. If you don't have a mic or use it often, this may not be the game for you. If you don't communicate with your team everybody is lost.PROS:+ Weapon mechanics (projectile trajectory, speed, spread, effectiveness, AOE, range, damage types, etc.)+ Map machanics (ability to hide or take damage in clouds or behind structures)+ Ship mechanics (shoot out the left engine and the enemy ship starts to list left)+ Skill (a skilled player understands the guns on their ship, what to load them with, which enemy to fire at, which components to repair, where each ship is strongest and weakest, and how to communicate effectively with teammates)CONS:- Only player vs. player (Alliance should offer player vs. environment shortly)- Strict emphasis on teamwork (it doesn't matter how good you are, you're only as good as your whole crew)- Poor sportsmanship (every game you get a bad apple who can't take losing well)- Clan imbalance (there's always that one clan that only teams up with each other, plays every day with each other, and continuously destroys new players and brags about it)- Element of surprise (You can see what ship the enemy is using, the weapons on their ship, what class each crew member is, what level they are, and what each player has equipped. A skilled captain will notice and switch their ship and weapons accordingly, however the enemy sees what you're doing as well so it's an endless battle of trying to be sneaky in the loadout screen. This really should be fixed.)- Class flexibility (there are 3 classes, but when you join a match you may be forced to choose a class you never play as because having two captains or gunners on one ship doesn't always make the most sense)

Posted: February 29, 2016
												I could say a lot of things. But I will simplify it with what I have been looking for a good time: This game has one of the best communities ever. Some rare times there may be someone that had a bad day and can't focus right, but almost everyone show respect and are fun and cool to play with, even this being a pvp game. Why does this happen? Because it's not a hardcore game. You won't have to expend every single millisecond of the game paying attention at what you are doing and have to make every move right. We have moments to breath and prepare for the tough parts before they arrive. I believe this method of stress reduction helps people being a lot nicer to each other. Another plus thing on this game: Flying stuff and steampunk game style, how not to enjoy that?

Posted: June 12, 2015
												I've honestly come to love this game.Teamwork is vital for good results, intelligence is richly rewarded and it tickles my love of steampunk fantasy. I can't get enough friends hooked on it.I have to rant though: At the moment, Gunners are terrible. There is nothing a Gunner does that an Engineer doesn't do better. Ammo-loading you say? Let's look at that: Engi can load an ammo type of their choice, which is usually all you need for a specific gun strategy, while also using a buff tool for better damage. They can also immunize themselves against fire without A: wasting ammo on heatsink or B: sacrificing ability to repair.Engineers are part of the crew. When they're not gunning they can do anything that needs doing. Buffing, repairing, putting out fires. A Gunner does nothing but shoot. If they lose their guns they're boned. If the ship's crashing they can't help much. The psychological profile of random Gunners alone is enough for me to ban them from my deck.Bottom line is you've got 4 people on the ship and every person not pulling their weight brings you closer to death. You want the best time in the sky, grab 3 friends and sort out who's piloting and which engineer does what. Do that and she'll be apples, mate.

Posted: December 4, 2013
												This game has a very solid hook in the core concept and gameplay: you play as part of a crew of four on an airship, which itself forms part of a team of 2-4 airships. Mayhem ensues: trying to keep track of everything that's going on with your pathetically limited first person view is a folly and a joy!There are lots of little issues around the edges; it's under active development by a smaller studio so some will be fixed and some won't. Server coverage is poor (Asia, America, Europe) - I get nothing in the green from Australia. (EDIT: There's since been a server added in Singapore.) Poor graphics in some instances can impede enjoyment & gameplay (for instance: lo-res textures make it impossible to tell whether you're about to crash into that canyon wall...)It can be a hard game to enjoy if you can't find a good crew.  So that's something to consider. Having a mic and feeling comfortable using it is a big help, but useless if you're the only one communicating - so if you can get enough friends to crew a ship together I highly recommend starting out that way.

Posted: September 14, 2015
												The feel and thrill you get when engaging in ship to ship combat and having to rely not only on your personal skills but on your own crew mates' as well is something you don't usually find in gaming.This is a game about cooperation and communication in a way that "realistic" war games fall short miles from.It is the most rewarding online experience I've had in years. Unique gameplay experience. Keeping me at the edge of my seat in a way I haven't seen in ages.Picture a stylish steampunk balloon under enemy fire: the Engineers are running around putting out fires and frantically fixing components, barely keeping up with the mounting damage; the Gunners are trying to return the damage they are taking with interest and maybe neutralize the enemies' guns and vital components to give themselves better odds before their own guns are taken out; the Captain is flying a ship with half the engines blown, the best gun out of commission and the balloon about to burst has to decide whether he can attempt to make a run for it or if it is better to bring all guns to bear and go down in a blaze of glory.

Posted: January 18, 2015
												This is honestly my favorite 4 player multiplayer game.  You can play it solo, but its far more fun to play with a 4 person crew that you can actually talk with.  There are constant balance updates, and quite a few game modes.  The game is unique and refreshing.  A little about the game:You play as one of 3 classes on a ship that is selected by the ship's captain.  The Pilot, Engineer, or Gunner.  Each has additional abilities based on what their class is supposed to do,  EG: the gunner has more ammo types he can use, the pilot has nitro, smoke screen, ect.  There are 6 or 7 ships, and every weapon hardpoint on each ship (either small or large) can be customized.  EG: you can fit a ship with 2 front flame throwers, or a gatling gun and a mortar, ect.  Crews are 4 people, and matches can have up to 8 ships in 1 battle.Conclusion:Its well worth the $15, and if you find it on sale, buy it without hesitation.  Even if you're not an avid fan of Steampunk era games, you will certainly enjoy this one.

Posted: July 12, 2014
												Guns of Icarus as a steampunk based zeppelin battle game consisting of the gamemodes Team Deathmatch, King of the Hill and Conquest; all the while with enviromental hazards and beautiful ethreal landscapes. This game is great for those that communicate via mic. Allthough mic communication is a strong suit, it is also a down fall. This game requires people to do certain specific jobs, so If the pilot and crew (Gunners/Engineers) dont inform eachother of their situation, the ship will breakdown in fire and eventually blow up. Everyone seems pretty up to speed though. The mic is particularly most important for the captain, If there is no mic available the player can proceed to use key voice commands. It is pretty much pirate ships powerd by Balloons and Engine Propellers.  The guns themself are a much different calibur then a typic pirate ship. Which forces decisive planning. The community itself is a bunch of characters. This is a very multicultural game where i've run into people from Europe and the U.k. (I live in the U.S.)  In the end, victory feels really like an acomplishment, which is always a plus in games. If anyone is interested in buying this, know your tools and abilities (4 slots to swap out in the lobby), it really helps due to the games being open match. Real people real trash talk consequences, and as for people on the internet go, they can be harsh, but as for the main tip, stay informed!  10/10 for maintained interest.

Posted: December 25, 2015
												+++++-Great game to play with friends if you have 3+ to have playsessions,-Looks pretty good and runs smooth on my average pc.-Huge amount of achievements for the explorers under you.-Several interesting ships to board-Easy to understand yet hard to master-Customisation-The games take a rather long time(comparable to a Dota or LoL game)--------If you don't have friends to play with and you are not highly into that whole steampunk themethen you may want to wait for some friends to buy this one:Long waiting times due to a low playerbase of 100-300 at the moment [End of 2015].There are no penalties for going afk or leaving from what I've seen.In most games I or the enemy team finds themselves left alone on a ship once filled with 4 real people (now one player and 3 AI).The AI doesn't seem to be able to pilot the ship thus more often then not you will eventually have to take on the role of the steering pilot of an abandoned ship.In the few games I've played there was even a case where a whole ship simply surrendered (2v2 fight) thus leaving one team in an unwinnable 1v2 scenario.The game contains some small micro transactions, it's not being forced upon you though.+-The community seems to be rather nice in voice chat (given the 40% that are usually left after the game ends)It contains a rather big number of little kids, so muting them will come in handy to you at some point.===> Personally I'd not recommend buying this being as a single person.          It might be worth checking out when it goes into sale so you'll gain a few hours of fun without regrets.          In case you have friends to play this with I can highly recommend this game to you as most annoying problems                                                       (leaving players/too few players/communication problems) vanish.See you on the battlefield /

Posted: June 30, 2015
												As the description of the game says, "With a good ship and the right crew, you can conquer the skies!" The chance of you having a good crew is Bacon and rat feces mixing in a bowl. You will never know if you will get a good piece of bacon or rat feces, or a piece of bacon covered in rat feces. But most of the time, you will probably get a good team, Guns of Icarus is a fun game to play with friends, and cooperate with the captain to destroy the other ships. It has great action, a cool customization menu, Different Roles that can help around the ship, and you can change some of the special items or bullets etc in the customization menu as well.There aren't many maps in the game, but the maps that are in the game are well made and have fun obstacles you can fly through if you're trying to shake a ship off your trail. It has different atmospheres depending on the map that you are playing on and a great action soundtrack for shooting down enemy ships.I didn't really understand why Guns of Icarus required money, as other multiplayer games don't. But i think the gameplay and the design and action of the game made it a good reason for it to require money. Whoever developed this game did a great job. I rate it a 9.7/10

content:
Posted: July 3, 2015
												This is a game. About pirate ships. That fly. And have large missile launchers, flamethrowers and a large assortment of other weapons. And you can shoot those. At other flying pirate ships. If that doesn't sound good to you, you clearly had no childhood.The idea of this game is to use your ariship to shoot down other airships. The core concept is very simple, and doesn't require Counter-Strike levels of aiming skill. However, don't let that fool you into thinking this game requires no skill. You still need to coordinate and compensate for movement on guns. The guns aren't hitscan like CS, which means you must compensate for projectile movement and lead your targets.There are 3 different roles:Pilot: Pilots the ship. Duh. Has several abilities to change ship functions, such as adding speed. Most of these damage some ship component.Engineer: Fixes anything that breaks/explodes. Can use fire extinguishers, and wield more than one repair tool. You can have 3 at one time, allowing you to adapt your fixing method depending on how many parts have exploded/lit on fire.Gunner: Holds different types of ammo that allows him to adapt to different situations. Need more fire? Got it. Need faster bullets? Sure!Each of these roles must work together in a crew of four to destroy enemy ships. The built in voice chat is excellent, providing you a great way to work together with teammates. If you don't have a mic, don't play this game. You won't enjoy it. The teamwork itself is quite satisfying(10 DEGREES TO PORT, CAPN! GET THAT HULL BACK UP, ENGIE!), and this is the part of the game that I enjoy the most. The multiplayer has a commendation system built in, as well as a report system. Most of the community is very friendly, and the salty ones get weeded out quickly.As for the variety, everything is unlocked from the start, meaning you can use every ship in the game(provided you're willing to get wrecked your first few games with large ships). Every gun on these ships is replaceable, allowing you to create your own loadouts suited for every situation. Sniper? Sure. Close range bruiser? You got it. Each crew member has a custom loadout that can be edited from the start as well.New to the game? Don't worry, there's a specific section of muiltiplayer dedicated to level 10 or below players. This limits the ships you can use to some simpler ones to get you used to the game. If you like, you can skip right into regular matchmaking.I highly recommend this game. The devs are great and still provide quality updates. I have no clue why people say this game is dead, there are 3K plus players online at any time. Filling lobbies is easy, getting everyone to ready up is the hard part. :P

Posted: June 8, 2016
Product received for free
												Do you like working in a team? Do you like chaotic situations? Do you like shooting down airships? If you answered yes to any of these questions, you'll probably like Guns of Icarus Online. Piloting a ship requires close coordination between the pilot, engineers, and gunners to make sure you can down other ships without being destroyed yourselves. Communication with other ships on your team is vital. Matches usually go one of two ways: someone isn't listening and it all falls apart, or everyone works together and beautiful things happen. Winning in Guns of Icarus requires both skill and teamwork—and that's why I love it.(Note: I recieved this game as a gift from a friend, so I checked the "recieved this for free" box. I have had no direct contact with the developers, and this review is my opinion alone.)(P.S. If this review motivated you to purchase Guns of Icarus (or you just want a code to enter), use my referral code nPv5xw so we can both get some gifts ingame! Just click the Community button in the top left, then click Review and Recruit in the bottom right. You only have 30 days to enter a code from account creation, so make sure you enter someone's code.)

Posted: January 10, 2015
												This game is a steampunk version of pirates of the carribean, as you steer a sub-par ship agaisnt other ships, the game works well alone, and you'll have a hard time being on your own, which is why the game requires that you assemble a team of 4 for your ship, you can rather have these people be your friends, or some random dudes who don't know what they're doing. The Ship mechanic is fresh, with instead holding down W or S or pushing up or down on the joystick, you have a speed toggle, so you lock the speed to 5 speeds, very fast reverse, reverse, stop, fast, very fast forward. My only problems so far is that sometimes your ship gets randomly thrown into mountains and hills, making you take damage for nothing. though this is only happened to me once. Apart from that this game is very fun and made me laugh alot. This game IS for friends so I recommend you buy the four pack.

Posted: May 25, 2014
												Pros + Cons-+Community+Gameplay+Ship customization+Class customization+Music+Atmosphere-Microtransaction cosmetics-Terrible AI-Player animationsFinal Score: 7/10If you love games with teamwork, games with great communities, or games with huge clunky armed airships, then I suggest this game.When you first go into the game, you are treated with an excellent theme song.  The string instruments mixed with cannon shots mixed with propellers really set the tone for the game.  I find myself humming the theme song whenever I start the game.Jumping into the tutorial, I felt a bit overwhelmed.  It's telling you to do all of this stuff and at the time I didn't know what the hell they were talking about.  But if you just just take is slowly then you will be able to understand.  If you have any question, just type it into the global chat and people would be happy to answer!The character customization is great and all, but for most of it you have to pay.  If this game was free to play than I would be fine with it, but the game is $15 full price, so it's not ideal.  It's not just character cosmetics, but ship cosmetics as well. However, there is some items you can get by leveling up, I was informed you could battle the devs every Tuesday and Thursday to get some snazzy cosmetics.Thankfully, you can customize both your ship and character layout.  You are given an ample amount of ship types to choose from, each with their own advantages and disadvantages, they are all very different from each other.  Not to mention that the game also has a bunch of weapon choices, all have unique uses.  Experimenting with different ships, guns, and even ammo is a hell of a ride.When you're customizing your character loadout, you have a choice of three classes: Pilot, Engineer, and Gunner.  You also have three catagories of items, each one corresponds to a class.  You can pick one item from two catagories, and three from another catagory, it all depends on your class.  If you're a gunner, you can pick one pilot item, one engineer item, and three gunner items.  It's a good system.The game requires coordination, so make sure you talk with your crew about a plan before the game starts, it will help out a lot trust me.  You'll have time to do this, due to the fact that it takes a while for a game to start most of the time.  This is because not many people play the game, so it takes a bit for the lobbies to fill.I'm not going to say much about going into your first battle, because I don't want to spoil the feeling.  All I have to say is, hold on to your♥♥♥♥♥because you're going on a wild ride.I recommend you go in with a full crew, not AI.  The AI is horrid in this game, it is impossible to win with a crew full of them.This next complaint is small, but it just bugs me a bit that the player animations are lazy.  I don't know how to explain it, but they aren't great.In conclusion, this game has a great atmosphere and great gameplay.  Just a few small gripes keep it from being pefect, so my final score is 7/10.  Go check it out.

Posted: August 13, 2014
												Guns of Icarus is in a nutshell, an FPS version of FTL but in its own way, its very unique. In a almost sprawling lore into a steampunk universe, a crew of 4 including you consiting of engineers, gunners and pilots, you and you crew work together in PvP matches to not only keep your ship afloat, but to make sure others dont do the same. With a range of weapons, from massive long-range mortors to short range flmaethrowers, you will find your place in a massive range of ships from the gun-heavy Galleon to the light and versatile Squid. You as a player will be immensly unique to others, with costumes consisting of hats, suits, glasses and so forth to your very characters skills in engineering, shooting, piloting and, (stressing this!), Leadership.Its now up to you. Will you conquer the skies through immense brute force and willingness to prevail? Or will you be cunning and corageous amongst your crew members and carry your reputation across the plains of sand and steel?

Posted: February 14, 2016
												This game is amazing.It's the next level of cooperation. You are not just a team pursuing a single goal.4 players here are part of an organism. Everybody is doing the best He can to keep the ship afloat. Pilot and 3 engineers / gunners are moving in one motion alike. Community is amazing, i haven't once seen anyone rage over losing. It always ends with a GG. "What if i am bad, if i make mistakes?" We are people. We make mistakes. We learn.And this community knows that. You'll be taught by better players, not looked down on.Obviously for Your own good it's best to keep to novice matches at begining. :) Now, how about those devs? They are great people. How do i know? You can test the game with them. Every saturday You can join a CO-OP match on newest dev patch, testing features and hunting bugs. They are polite and nice.Want to know Their history? Look up "Guns of icarus development Lore" on Youtube. You'll see how hard They worked to accomplish what They have now. This rises another question. What DO They have now?A nearly bugless amazing experience bonding players together in the blast of FLAK explosions. As a in-real sailor and steampunk enthusiast, this is a must have.

Posted: June 25, 2014
												This is one of the most lovingly well-crafted games I have ever seen. There is something about the way that the developers balance all of the components, from time-management, to customization, to sheer fighting force, that it creates an environment which fosters amazing teamwork and sportsmanship. In addition, it also makes for the nicest community of any game I've played.Graphics 9/10While the graphics aren't quite as photo-realistic as some of the big name games out there (CoD, Halo, etc…) they are beautifully crafted, and present a rough and rugged steampunk setting. The ships themselves are detailed and full of moving parts, which serve as a reminder that you aren't on just some video-game ship, but a real piece of machinery. The landscapes, too, are stunning, and though up close, the textures are slightly lacking, when you are mid air, it makes for some amazing vistas. The combination of sublime natural beauty and post-apocalyptic destruction is successful. In particular, I am fond of the WWII era battleship half-sunk in the sand of Battle on the Dunes, and the wreckage of an airship skeleton on Duel at Dawn.Story 8/10 (tentative)Well, since there isn't a real storyline as of yet, this rating is a little based on potential I see, but from the meta-game material I've seen, the introductions shown on each map, and the imminent advent of adventure mode, I am very excited for how the story will develop. From the hints, though, things are looking pretty cool.Music 8/10The music in this game is well-crafted, if not quite as creative or actual-music-y as the soundtrack of Bastion, per se, but what they do have, is a soundtrack that modulates based on play. When you spawn, there is no music, but as you near other ships, ominous drums begin to play, followed by flutes playing war cries, then more and more of the orchestra come in as the battle intensifies. This lends a great tension to the game, and makes for a very satisfying battle experience.Gameplay 10/10There is nothing that I can really fault the gameplay for at large. Sometimes glitches creep in, but the devs are very good about fixing them. In terms of genre, it's hard to say where to place this. It really depends on your class. There are three classes: The Pilot, The Engineer, and The Gunner. When you are playing with the pilot, the game plays like a dogfighter, only a little slower, since you're flying a ship rather than a plane (Though planes are in the works, apparently). This is not to say that it is boring. On the contrary, the 3D movement is very fluid, and competent captains can pull off some pretty amazing moves. Also, there are a variety of piloting tools to allow your ship to perform better. As engineer, you are playing a time management game, combined with a bit of fps, and a bit of parkour. You have to keep all the components repaired, but also might need to do daring jumps around the ship to get to them fast enough. Instead of boring time-management, though, there is always a great deal of excitement as the engineer, since the tension of the battle spices things up, and you need to negotiate with your crew. As Gunner, you're playing a turret-based fps, with some time management. The guns are very satisfying, and aiming is a good challenge, especially with arcing mortars or sniper rifles. However, where this game really shines is the crew and team cooperation. The captain commands his crew, but the crew also has to negotiate themselves and make sure that the ship is in tip-top shape (and the enemies aren't). Quite often, there is a quick friendship formed between the crew and captain, and a banter on the ship is not uncommon. Furthermore, there is another layer of teamwork as the captain must team up with the other ships on his team. The voice chat is very smooth, and it is highly recommended, since communication is critical.Community 10/10The learning curve on this game is a little steep, but luckily (unless you fail to communicate at all), you will be helped out by higher level players. Most level 15's are happy to play with level 1's and will give them commands to help them learn. It's very rare that you meet a troll, and the community usually snuffs them out with the power of friendship and love. The lobbies are usually lively, and conversations between games are usually off-topic and fun. However, people who want to play seriously will do so, but still with a sense of fun. Furthermore, there are frequent tournaments and player hosted events like ship racing. One of the best parts, however, is the dev involvement. There are devs on almost every day, and most players have a chance to play with them. When you send an email, they respond within hours, usually, and will not hesitate to post in every steam discussion. Balance 10/10This game is not pay-to-win, which is awesome. You can buy things, but they are only cosmetic, and very cheap, so nobody is ever ahead by money. Better still, when you level, you don't unlock new weapons, which would give high level players an even higher advantage. You do unlock cool costumes, and badges, though, which is more than fair compensation. All of the ships are equal, and nothing is really OP in the game, so really, the team with the best strategy and teamwork wins, not the higher level players with more money.Overall 10/10The reviews gave this game a bad rep, because of its glitchiness in the beta. DO NOT BELIEVE METACRITIC. Those are early reviews of and early version. If the reviews reflected the current version, they would be far higher. Honestly, I think this is a game for everybody. Get it while it's on sale if you can, but it's well worth the $15. It's definitely better with friends, though, so if you can, get a 4-pack and play with your friends as crew. There is no reason for this not to be the top team-based game in the world. Buy it now, and make the awesome community even awesomer.

Posted: July 18, 2013
												A competitive ship based game that relies on group cooperation and crew communication, Guns of Icarus is a unique team multiplayer experience. You play as one of three roles on a steampunk style airship as part of a crew of four. You then work together with your fellow players to keep the ship in prime condition as you engage other vessels. Pilots take the helm, engineers make sure everything is at prime condition, and gunners fire upon threats. No one is more important than the other and there is no emphasis on becoming the star player. The best players are cogs in a well oiled machine along with their crew, as it's their ship that's the star.While I think this game is definitely worth full price, as a strategy I suggest grabbing this game during any kind of sale and if you enjoy it, then make up the difference by purchasing some of the cosmetic microtransactions available. This is not play to win. All ships and weapons are unlocked from the start, but if you wish, you can purchase little bits and bobs to make your character look good and make a special outfit for each class. Additionally, an adventure mode DLC is coming soon which will contain a cooperative campaign, so even more reason to fly with some friends!Aesthetically, the game looks stellar with fantastic environments to fly along and beautiful skies. The music is atmospheric and tense all at once, not taking away from the experience. Subjectively, character models look good for the most part, but male faces leave something to be desired and there are some blurry textures on pieces of the environment yet the ships themselves are lovingly put together and textured.The gunplay with the weapons feels good, and depending on the weapon you have, you can tell there's a lot of power behind it. Some weapons feel a bit lackluster, like the gatling gun. While it does a great job in damaging an enemies hull, it just doesn't sound like a powerful gatling gun as you'd expect. That's really the only weapon I've found that doesn't feel great handling. Additionally, it's absolutely amazing (Or terrifying if it's the enemy) seeing a vessel firing their payloads on another.Controls wise, this game handled great. Flying a ship feels realistic, momentum plays a factor, and you do feel like you are actually piloting something. Running around on foot is just like any FPS and is perfectly responsive (Just don't forget to turn off mouse smoothing). Keep in mind, that while you can control the character like an FPS, it's not an FPS. Boarding is not a factor and for good reason. It's not about killing players, it's about killing ships (Which have players on them), and players must work together to do such.In conclusion, the developers seem very excited to continue improving their game and just looking on the forums show they are quite dedicated to it. If you're at all interested in an awesome multiplayer experience that focuses on ship crews and working together, then take to the skies!

Posted: May 27, 2014
												This is a wonderful game. -It delivers what it offers, a great co-op game with intense gameplay. Community is really good, everyone usually follows orders, there are no rude people/trolls etc. to ruin your game. Devs regularly play the game and really clean up foul players. But as always, there are some stubborn people that "MUST BE A GUNNER!111!" or sometimes an engineer not doing their job and gunning instead, but these are rare occurances. As long as someone gives the orders, such things are avoided.-Game is well balanced and benefits highly from the use of tactics. It's not a rock-paper-scissors thing either, everything works as long as you know how to use them.-Servers are working just fine, even though I'm a bit far to Europe for instance(Turkey), I get 70-100 ms ping. Which is really good.-Crashes very rarely occur, I played for about 20 hours and experienced only one crash. There are minor bugs, but no gamebreaking bugs.-It has a online shop, but it's not a pay-2-win, the items are entirely cosmetic, and quite well priced. (If you're so inclined to decorate your ship and suit up your characters, it would only cost 10 dolars.)So in the end, do buy this game if you like teamwork and wreaking havoc with a flamethrower, because that's what you'll get.

Posted: February 13, 2014
												This game has what a steam punk junkie needs. Well, at least for air-ship to air-ship combat. Play a pilot and fly your ship through the maps and out wit you enemies, or shoot them down as a gunner with any of the veriety of weapons mounted on the ship or, keep your crew alive with one of the most important rolls by bashing parts back together with a wrench as an engineer. This team based game is also just as beautiful as it is spectacularly entertaining. The graphics shine brightly and have a bit of an old timely grain to them as if being watched through an old film projector and on some maps the rain splashes in your eyes obscuring your vision slightly. The best thing about this game is the community though. Developers are constantly online taking notes and playing in matches with the players and the players themselves have been nothing but friendly sore the occasional troll or angry Russian pilot. The game does fall flat on a few things though such as game type veriety and the ungodly A.I. engineers as well as some unbalanced ship builds and the fact that pilots, gunners and engineers have no significant advantage over one another accept for having more equipment for their assigned rolls. Posted: February 20, 2014
												Guns of Icarus Online has a wonderful teamwork aspect to it in which most other games don't really provide. Most games have a certain objective and then everyone can go off and do their own thing. With this game, you all have to work together and provide key communication in order to own the skies and take the victory.The game's graphics may not be as high as big brand games, but they sure are detailed enough to get the point across. The engine performs amazingly and I have had no trouble whatsoever in figuring out how to play. The controls are put up on screen (providing you kept the tips on) so that even the most novice of players can get a grip for the controls.Customization is also very big in this game. Not only can you customize your character's appearance, but you can customize your ship down to the last weapon. Want a flamethrower on your vessel? Go right ahead! The game already has a large selection of weapons for you to use so go ahead and use them!All in all this game is great and it really does show in the dynamic of its performance, quality, and playability. The easy controls, stunning design, and almost limitless customization makes this game perfect for those who seek action, and great team playing.

												What can I say. This game is a gold coin on the sidewalk of Steam just waiting to be picked up. If you enjoy flying gunships and running around like a headless chicken while your friends scream "argh, fix the hull! fix the hull, god dammit!" then this is the game for you.The aerial combat is brilliant; there are microtransactions, but they are purely for cosmetic purposes and so it doesn't affect your gameplay. The teamwork element is the strongest part of this game; I guarantee you will hate it if you don't man a ship with 3 people with mics; or good friends.There are a few downsides, mainly that there don't appear to be a lot of maps and the fact that there isn't a large player-base at the moment, which is a dead shame.Overall, if you want to test your friendships; revel at beautiful landscapes; and wage engaging aerial wars, then you have to buy this game.

Posted: June 8, 2016
Product received for free
												Do you like working in a team? Do you like chaotic situations? Do you like shooting down airships? If you answered yes to any of these questions, you'll probably like Guns of Icarus Online. Piloting a ship requires close coordination between the pilot, engineers, and gunners to make sure you can down other ships without being destroyed yourselves. Communication with other ships on your team is vital. Matches usually go one of two ways: someone isn't listening and it all falls apart, or everyone works together and beautiful things happen. Winning in Guns of Icarus requires both skill and teamwork—and that's why I love it.(Note: I recieved this game as a gift from a friend, so I checked the "recieved this for free" box. I have had no direct contact with the developers, and this review is my opinion alone.)(P.S. If this review motivated you to purchase Guns of Icarus (or you just want a code to enter), use my referral code nPv5xw so we can both get some gifts ingame! Just click the Community button in the top left, then click Review and Recruit in the bottom right. Posted: June 28, 2014
												Guns of icarus online is a super unique and super fun experience. the game is an airship combat game, where you and 3 other people crew an airship and co-ordonate to take down the enemy. For those unwilling or reserved about communicating (specifically verbally but also in text) with your fellow crew members it may be a little hard for you, as this game requires a large amount communication and co-ordonataion to function as each member needs to communcate to take down the enemy, whilst also keeping your own ship airborn.guns of icarus has 3 classes. gunner, engineer and pilot. each pretty much self explanatory as to what they specialize in. each class has different loadouts and skills they can customize to the players liking, along with how they look depending if you're willing to spend more money on cosmetics. Whilst admitably lacking in differing gamemodes besides how many ships can be fighting at a time (i.e 1v1 2v2 etc) the game makes up for it with a good variety of ship and weapon choices and the fact that each battle will mostly likely not play out the same twice. one team may have an upper hand one game but be absolutely stomped the next.If the idea of airship based combat where communication with your crew is key sound good to you, you'll most likely love Guns of icarus. its an excellent game and pretty cheap to boot. 8/10

Posted: June 28, 2014
												This is probably one of the most satisfying games I've played in a long time. Nothing is better than being in a crew that can work well together and mow down anything that comes within firing range.Overview:Guns of Icarus Online is a steampunky deathmatch multiplayer game where teams of 2 or 3 airships, each maned by crews of 4, fight it out on various landscapes. You can choose between 3 classes: a pilot, gunner or engineer, each with roles necessary to keep your ship from being a scortched pile on the ground. The beauty with the classes is that no one class is "better" than another, you play whatever role suits you the most at whatever time.Classes:The pilot is the head of the ship, generally the one to call the shots and make up the strategies while maneuvering the ship to get out of danger or to line up the guns. I personally don't have a lot of experience with this class because I'm terrible at piloting but the controls for the ship aren't that difficult, it takes a little getting used to but the training match will help you with that.The gunner does exactly what you think they do, puts big holes into peoples ships with different ammo. You can make yourself very familiar with the different weapons and ammunition by looking at the ship customizations as they all have easy to understand statistics and by testing them out in the training.The engineer is the poor bugger stuck with keeping things from breaking and catching fire when the pilot screws up. All jokes aside, as the engineer your job is the keep everything on the ship running and in good condition. It's a very daunting task at first because the ships have so many components to keep track of but the game has a very good interface that shows the durability/status of each component at all times on your screen. It helps to know the layout of your ship so you know where to run when you see that fire symbol flashing on your balloon. Personally I find the engineer to be the most rewarding class even though you don't always get the praise for keeping the ship up.Loadouts:You can customize your loadouts for each character to provide for various needs on the ship. The loadouts are split between gunner (ammunitions), engineering (repair tools) and piloting (mobility modifiers) slots. Each class has one slot in the group they're not in and multiple in their own (for example, engineers have 1 gunner, 1 pilot and 3 engineer slots). You can coordinate with your crew to create loadouts that best fit your strategy.Maps:There are a good variety of maps, each with their hazards and strategies involved. Some may have dust storms which conceal your ship but damage the engines while others can have hard to navigate terrains with good ambushing opprotunities. They are diverse enough to not feel like the same map over and over again but not over the top to feel like they're out of place. They're all a good size and feel very creative in their design.Ships:You can take your pick from 7 ships , each with their own advantages and disadvantages. Each ship can be customized by giving them custom names, aesthetic changes if you unlock them and you can choose the guns that go on the available slots. Depending on the ship and gun location you can have light or heavy weapons, each weapon is more effective against certain ship components and have specific ammo properties (such as explosive, fletchette, piercing etc.) The ships do feel very balanced especially when piloted by the right crews so there's nothing that feels OP or unbalanced to go up against. A death generally feels like it's the fault of the crew instead a fault in the balancing.Coop:What really makes this game special is the cooperation within your crew and your team. The creators have made it very easy to coordinate with your crew and team by having chat options split between crew, team and global (with text and voice) all accessed by the touch of one key. The game is held together by the premise of working as a team, each crew member needs to pull their weight and communicate well to work at full potential.Cons:-I've had some performance issues especially when everything is on fire at once, the most recent patch has definitely helped with that but keep in mind you might get some lag when the flamethrowers light you up.-It can be a bit overwhelming at first since there are so many ships with so many weapons with so many stats and so many loadout choices. Start out small and get a feel for the game and it's mechanic and you'll be fine.I definitely recommend this game especially since it's on sale right now. I'd be honoured to try to put out the infinite fires on your ship!

Posted: August 6, 2014
												An excellent game with an even better community, which is mainly what makes it so great. The gameplay itself is often manic, and extremely good fun - but you'll need to collaborate with your 3 other crewmates in order to take down enemy ships (I cannot stress enough how important it is to have good communication with your crew, as well as good tactics). The voice chat feature makes this very easy, but if you don't fancy speaking to strangers over the internet, there's a text chat option as well - most people are very friendly! Communication and familiarity with your crewmembers is greatly aided by the clan system, which forms the basis of the online community: you can get to know people in your clan and develop rivalries with other clans, against whom your clan may be pitted in the frequent tournaments that take place. Tactics play as important a part as execution in this game, with captains of the ship able to change ship loadouts to suit their crew and opponents; ship customisation is also available. All three roles of gunner, engineer and pilot are very fun to play, and you'll soon find which one you like best - most people start with engineer as it is often the most straightforward, at least when you're new to the game. There is a fairly comprehensive tutorial system inbuilt, as well as the game forums for more information and excellent community guides. My only complaint would be that it takes a very long time to level up all of your classes, as this is done by earning achievements and not directly controlled by the amount of time spent playing the game: but this is clearly a deliberate choice made by the developers (who, incidentally, are very active in the community) and you still have a great time playing the game.In short, an excellent little game that will keep you absorbed for a long time as you grow familiar with its nuances and finer tactics.

Posted: August 9, 2015
												Wow.. so..This game is incredible. So incredible that I would recommend it to anyone with three other friends that are willing to spend money on it too.But that's just that. If you don't have 3 other friends whom you can Skype or voice chat with.. don't even think about getting this game. It's not worth the annoyance. Yeah, there are voice chat options in-game but it all is pretty irrelevant because they're not going to listen to orders you give (if you're captain) and not all of them will know your lingo. The command "right, right, right, right" might be "AIM RIGHT" to them, when in fact you're meaning to get on the right gun. Or "left, uptop, barrage" might just mean "shoot randomly". It's not a game you can just sit down and enjoy casually. Every round is intense, thick with teamwork and if your team is properly put together.. there isn't much you can't do. If you aren't constantly updating your friends on the goings-ons of the ship.. YOU WILL DIE. If they can't listen to you.. YOU WILL DIE. Every win, every hit, every barrage will feel like you are personally on the ship.. you become almost intimate with your ship. When your balloon gets critically injured your ship sinks.. and so does your spirits as you mash the W key to ascend because the ground is coming up at a very fast rate.It's so ♥♥♥♥ing worth it if you can assemble a team of 3.

Posted: September 22, 2016
												This is very much a teamwork-based game.You are on a ship with 3 other people and all of you must work together to keep the ship running and in firing at enemies.  You also have 1-3 allied ships (each with their own crews) on your team.What this means is that you want to be playing this game with friends.  Ideally get a 4-pack and give 3 copies to your friends and then play with all four of you as the crew of a ship.  If you don’t have any friends to play with, then make some in game.  Joining a clan will help you develop a group of people that you can play with and that you know you can rely on.  I’m not going to go into too many details about the gameplay, but the rough overview is that you have one pilot who moves the ship and communicates with allied pilots.  You also have three other crewmembers that fire guns and repair components on the ship.  There are different ships, gun loadouts, ammo types, tool loadouts, etc. to choose from.Cosmetics can be purchased, but provide no gameplay advantages.The playerbase is usually small (a couple hundred people online at most), although in the aftermath of sales it can be much greater.  You have a generally friendly community and active devs, who you will often find in matches as well.Yeah, that about sums it up.  Also, prepare to spend lots of time in lobbies.

Posted: November 10, 2014
												I personally think this game is great. I have some issues with it, but on the whole I think it is good. The needed coordination among teammates is essential, and I think what really makes this game is what they DIDN'T add. Lack of boarding, and hand-to-hand combat really emphasize teamwork, and if you don't have a good team, you are screwed.Some of the things I dislike are mostly minor, and I think will be fixed with time. The graphics are good, but on certain maps, (i.e. any with rain, or fog) I feel like it was poorly done. Also, the lack of game modes begins to get to you after a while, but they are working on adventure mode, the DLC for which i will definitely buy. On the whole, I would give it a 7/10, and I would love to give it more, but it is not the kind of game you could lose yourself in.I built up a ton of expectation about this one, and while unrealistic, it feels slightly like a letdown. But it will get better, and what they have now is impressive. Good work guys.

Posted: November 13, 2014
												Don't be discouraged by metacritic - read user reviews if you must.I don't remember when I have played some multiplayer game that is so unique. It's not simply team-based game that you are just scoring by killing enemy but the key to victory is teamwork. Destroying enemy is also important but in order to do so teamwork is necessary. You are one of 4 crew ship member and you playing as pilot, gunner or engineer. It's not like these are locked classes, but you are choose what you want to do and what you are good at. What's even more amazing is how great community in Guns of Icarus Online is. Even with low level players, everybody tries to do their best in order to win. I'm not big fan of steampunk and to be honest I had hard time trying to play this game, at first it looked "meh" but I don't regret it, once I tried and I really like this game. It's nothing like any FPS games, MOBA or other genre that are avaible. Guns of Icarus Online is truly unique as multiplayer game.

Posted: December 9, 2013
												I've never seen a game like this - and I'm saying that in the best way possible. It's basically a cooperative steampunk dirigible deathmatch - you can play as:Engineer - fixing the ship's systems and ensuring the ship won't fall apart,Gunner - gunning down enemies' ships to ensure your team has the upper hand and a winning chance, or the Pilot, whose strategic vision and skillful flight insures that the Gunner has a target to be shooting at and the Engineer to have enough time to repair everything.Immensely fun steampunk strategy/shooter/teamwork builder.And the best part is that the developers are in the global chat almost always and are these veeery cool fellas with great vision - they're currently working on an ADVENTURE MODE - AN OPEN WORLD of steampunk exploration, collaboration and general awesomeness.I would totally recommend this game to everyone who loves steampunk, wants to break the ordinary and NEEDS a breath of fresh, awesome air.

Posted: March 23, 2016
												Guns of Icarus is a challenging team deathmatch/capture the flag strategy game themed around steampunk zeplin warfare. Each player chooses a class to play as (captain, engineer, or gunner) and that player works together with their 4-man crew and other ally ships to defeat enemy ships. I've played this game for 2 years now and go through phases with this game. I always get excited to play it again but when I do somebody always ruins the experience and I decide not to play again for another few months. I've also noticed that this game is very popular in north-western countries like England, Scotland, and Ireland (about 75% of people on your server are probably European...not sure exactly why that is, but it's neat). This game is heavily communication oriented. If you don't have a mic or use it often, this may not be the game for you. If you don't communicate with your team everybody is lost.PROS:+ Weapon mechanics (projectile trajectory, speed, spread, effectiveness, AOE, range, damage types, etc.)+ Map machanics (ability to hide or take damage in clouds or behind structures)+ Ship mechanics (shoot out the left engine and the enemy ship starts to list left)+ Skill (a skilled player understands the guns on their ship, what to load them with, which enemy to fire at, which components to repair, where each ship is strongest and weakest, and how to communicate effectively with teammates)CONS:- Only player vs. player (Alliance should offer player vs. environment shortly)- Strict emphasis on teamwork (it doesn't matter how good you are, you're only as good as your whole crew)- Poor sportsmanship (every game you get a bad apple who can't take losing well)- Clan imbalance (there's always that one clan that only teams up with each other, plays every day with each other, and continuously destroys new players and brags about it)- Element of surprise (You can see what ship the enemy is using, the weapons on their ship, what class each crew member is, what level they are, and what each player has equipped. A skilled captain will notice and switch their ship and weapons accordingly, however the enemy sees what you're doing as well so it's an endless battle of trying to be sneaky in the loadout screen. This really should be fixed.)- Class flexibility (there are 3 classes, but when you join a match you may be forced to choose a class you never play as because having two captains or gunners on one ship doesn't always make the most sense)

Posted: May 24, 2014
												Alright, so for my review.I am going to start with the visuals.So I am going to say that the ships themselves look really good. The textures for the walls, balloons, and guns and everything are really pretty nice. It has a very fun look to it. Sadly, look past the ship and be ready to see what apear to be giant mounds of fecal matter surrounded by gasios fog. The rocks, walls, buildings, and everything past your ship and other peoples ships look really lack luster, and it is really distracting from the otherwise nice apeal in of the ship.So now onto the actual gameplay.I am going to say this game is super fun to play. Like great fun. People over the voice chat are friendly and helpfull, the shooting mechanics are good, the controlls are snappy, it has a great mix of shooting, defense, and repairs and it is actually quite fun to jump around the airship fixing things and firing back at the enemy. While the in game transactions are a little anoying for a game that I payed for, they are mostly cosmetic and have little to no effect on the actual gameplay. The best in my opinion is the team death match, where you have two airships on your team and the equal amount on the other team, and you stratagise and team up to kill each other. It is great, and it can get really intense at some points. The best part of this game is when you get a group of friends on the same boat, and you can voice chat and stuff to comunicate enemy positions and directions. I have one gripe about the gameplay though.... And that is, a few of my friends on lower end rigs had some issues with clipping and some bad lag. This should not be the case with a meh looking game written in the unity engine.Difficulty: A lot of people in their reviews have pointed out that there can be a small learning curve when you first enter the game. I would agree with this, but I would also say that it is still fun when you are learning and it does not take long to get working like a well oilded machine.Overall, I would say this game is a load of fun if you can look past some poor textures and some poorly optimised gameplay. thesupergeek rates this a 12/10 for fun and a 8/10 for graphics. I will most likely play much more of this game over the summer.

Posted: September 3, 2015
												Definitely one of the most enjoyable coop games I had the chance to play (provided you find the right people, that is, but that is an issue all games have).+Purely experience and skill-based game, with no reliance on level or exclusive equipment to defeat opponents+Various playstyle possibilities depending on your airship type, its loadout and your equipment.+With all the games dependant on quick reflexes and APM more than anything else, a game basing your proficiency on tactical and strategic approach is definitely a blow of fresh air in the teamwork-oriented PvP games.+Aesthetically pleasing+Steampunk *_* (dieselpunk, whatevs, you get the "drill" :P)+Heavily teamwork reliant, at the same time clearly set goals and easy approach make it easier for people to actually work TOGETHER in a teamwork-oriented game for a change.+Challenging, and always leaving a room for improvement in your ship destroying efficiency.+One of the best gaming communities out there :*-(Applies to open games only, doesn't really affect premade teams)Either takes a long time to start a match OR you start a match fast with people not knowing the plan behind your ship and its choice of layout.-Some achievements are RIDICULOUSLY hard to do (sorry, completionists :<)

Posted: November 30, 2013
												Please, if you're even slightly interested in this game, stick with me to the end.At first, I was turned off of this game. The in-game cosmetic microtransactions in a paid game, and a couple of friends' opinions of it did not sell it for me. But, when another friend of mine gave me the game so that I could crew on his ships, and I gave it another look...I found my new favorite game.The developers have put in a lot of time, effort, and love into their creation and their community. They're quite involved with the people that play their game, and many if not all of them play their game every chance they get, twice a week.The in-game cosmetic store, let me say, is optional. Nothing you buy will affect your gameplay...AND, any piece in the store can be earned for free in dev matches, hosted Tuesdays and Thursdays, if you're feeling particularly frugal.About the game itself, think of it as "3D naval battles" against other teams of people. Each crew of four works together to man a ship, which is chosen by the captain. Each ship flies differently, and uses different tactics and strategies to be effective. The most important aspects to winning this game are, in my opinion, communication, morale, and teamwork, in that order. Everything else is gravy.Guns of Icarus: Online is seriously underrated, and I hope that everyone gives it a chance. But I must say, it's even better if you have someone to fly with. Bring a friend or two, and you won't regret it!

												This a very fun game. You and three other crew members man an airship. There are engineers, pilots, and gunners. You can man a gun, pilot the ship, or fix it. Posted: August 14, 2014
												This is a game about having teams of four each in one flying zeppelin-like ship trying to blow up the enemy's vessels at the same time they try to hold their own together in one piece. Whether the objective is just destroying the opposite team, capture a point or any other thing, team work is essential to keep the ship flying. There are three classes you can pick: Pilot (usually the crew captain as well, since he is the one chosing the ship; has perks for piloting), Gunner (packs different kinds of ammunition to supply the ship's weapons) and Engineer (has multiple repairing tools and sometimes buffers to face any damage the ship could suffer). While any class can do any job, each one has something in which he is better at than any other. You can use the ship's guns to shoot the enemy's and depending where you hit, the rival vessel will recieve damage in different coponents and then suffer negative effects until repaired. Team work will be needed both between ships in the same team and within the ship's crew itself. Better bring some friends.+ Good graphics and entretaining gameplay.+ Multiple ships to try out, each of them with customizable layout. All have strengths and weaknesses.+ Three customizable classes to play.+ The battle system is great and intense. Will require a lot of strategy.+ All ships, weapons, tools and perks are available from the start, but you'll have to choose which ones you want.- If the crew doesn't work together, or at the very least follow the captains commands, the ship is doomed. Period. You can still loose by playing alongside the team, but not doing that almost grants that you won't win. Building up a crew just with friends is most of the times the best thing you can do.- Is almost mandatory to have a microphone when playing this game, or otherwise being a fast typer, since you'll have to communicate with the rest of the crew if you want to have any chance of winning.- The "Novice Player" status is given to you automatically until you reach level four in any of the classes, which doesn't allow you to use some ships and forces certains layouts in the one you can use, and that kindda sucks. However, it can be disabled in the configuration menu.This game gets a 8 out of 10.

Posted: July 12, 2014
												Guns of Icarus as a steampunk based zeppelin battle game consisting of the gamemodes Team Deathmatch, King of the Hill and Conquest; all the while with enviromental hazards and beautiful ethreal landscapes. This game is great for those that communicate via mic. Allthough mic communication is a strong suit, it is also a down fall. This game requires people to do certain specific jobs, so If the pilot and crew (Gunners/Engineers) dont inform eachother of their situation, the ship will breakdown in fire and eventually blow up. Everyone seems pretty up to speed though. The mic is particularly most important for the captain, If there is no mic available the player can proceed to use key voice commands. It is pretty much pirate ships powerd by Balloons and Engine Propellers.  The guns themself are a much different calibur then a typic pirate ship. Which forces decisive planning. The community itself is a bunch of characters. This is a very multicultural game where i've run into people from Europe and the U.k. (I live in the U.S.)  In the end, victory feels really like an acomplishment, which is always a plus in games. If anyone is interested in buying this, know your tools and abilities (4 slots to swap out in the lobby), it really helps due to the games being open match. Real people real trash talk consequences, and as for people on the internet go, they can be harsh, but as for the main tip, stay informed!  10/10 for maintained interest.

Posted: July 18, 2013
												A competitive ship based game that relies on group cooperation and crew communication, Guns of Icarus is a unique team multiplayer experience. You play as one of three roles on a steampunk style airship as part of a crew of four. You then work together with your fellow players to keep the ship in prime condition as you engage other vessels. Pilots take the helm, engineers make sure everything is at prime condition, and gunners fire upon threats. No one is more important than the other and there is no emphasis on becoming the star player. The best players are cogs in a well oiled machine along with their crew, as it's their ship that's the star.While I think this game is definitely worth full price, as a strategy I suggest grabbing this game during any kind of sale and if you enjoy it, then make up the difference by purchasing some of the cosmetic microtransactions available. This is not play to win. All ships and weapons are unlocked from the start, but if you wish, you can purchase little bits and bobs to make your character look good and make a special outfit for each class. Additionally, an adventure mode DLC is coming soon which will contain a cooperative campaign, so even more reason to fly with some friends!Aesthetically, the game looks stellar with fantastic environments to fly along and beautiful skies. The music is atmospheric and tense all at once, not taking away from the experience. Subjectively, character models look good for the most part, but male faces leave something to be desired and there are some blurry textures on pieces of the environment yet the ships themselves are lovingly put together and textured.The gunplay with the weapons feels good, and depending on the weapon you have, you can tell there's a lot of power behind it. Some weapons feel a bit lackluster, like the gatling gun. While it does a great job in damaging an enemies hull, it just doesn't sound like a powerful gatling gun as you'd expect. That's really the only weapon I've found that doesn't feel great handling. Additionally, it's absolutely amazing (Or terrifying if it's the enemy) seeing a vessel firing their payloads on another.Controls wise, this game handled great. Flying a ship feels realistic, momentum plays a factor, and you do feel like you are actually piloting something. Running around on foot is just like any FPS and is perfectly responsive (Just don't forget to turn off mouse smoothing). Keep in mind, that while you can control the character like an FPS, it's not an FPS. Boarding is not a factor and for good reason. It's not about killing players, it's about killing ships (Which have players on them), and players must work together to do such.In conclusion, the developers seem very excited to continue improving their game and just looking on the forums show they are quite dedicated to it. If you're at all interested in an awesome multiplayer experience that focuses on ship crews and working together, then take to the skies!

Posted: July 20, 2014
												Guns of Icarus is one of the best multiplayer experiences I've ever had online.  If you love games where teamwork is essential, then this is right up your alley. It can be a bit rough in the beginning trying to fly and determining how to fire each gun, but there are practice areas to work on your skills and much of the community is good for advice and helping out newer players.  This game has a lot of potential.  So far there are a few different game modes like deathmatch and king of the hill, but there are plenty more I can think of that would work for this game.  Also there are currently plenty of guns and seven ship frames to customize and I can see there being more in the future.  If they could bring in the level of customization of EVE Online, this game could really shine.  I would enjoy seeing the likes of different engines, hull/armor, balloon customs that would really make your ship YOURS, as well as seeing the changes visibly as well. As it stands, this is a solid game for $15.00 and well worth that price to me for the amount of fun I'm having.  I would really recommend grabbing a 4-pack for your friends if you have other gamers that you could get to play with you. It was absolutely worth it at the price of 2 copies and you will much more enjoy the game if you can voice chat with people you know and really coordinate your attacks.

However, the incentive to continue playing is thru achievements. Also, after awhile this game can be repetitive. If you like ships of varied design and battling just for the fun of it. This is the game for you.I really like this game. As it just takes to the action without much story or reason.

Posted: May 27, 2014
												This is a wonderful game. -It delivers what it offers, a great co-op game with intense gameplay. Community is really good, everyone usually follows orders, there are no rude people/trolls etc. to ruin your game. Devs regularly play the game and really clean up foul players. But as always, there are some stubborn people that "MUST BE A GUNNER!111!" or sometimes an engineer not doing their job and gunning instead, but these are rare occurances. As long as someone gives the orders, such things are avoided.-Game is well balanced and benefits highly from the use of tactics. It's not a rock-paper-scissors thing either, everything works as long as you know how to use them.-Servers are working just fine, even though I'm a bit far to Europe for instance(Turkey), I get 70-100 ms ping. Which is really good.-Crashes very rarely occur, I played for about 20 hours and experienced only one crash. There are minor bugs, but no gamebreaking bugs.-It has a online shop, but it's not a pay-2-win, the items are entirely cosmetic, and quite well priced. (If you're so inclined to decorate your ship and suit up your characters, it would only cost 10 dolars.)So in the end, do buy this game if you like teamwork and wreaking havoc with a flamethrower, because that's what you'll get.

Posted: May 21, 2014
												If you ever wanted to be a mighty sky pirate piloting your own ship and crew, an engineer who franticly runs between the upper and lower decks of the ship repairing stuff of your flying metal coffin, or a gunner who is just a tad bit to enthusiastic to be disabling the enemies ship systems 1 by 1 like their that creepy kid on the playground that tears the limbs off of insects, Guns Of Icarus may just be the 4 player multiplayer co-op for you!Since you will be stuck on a small ship with 3 other players, teamwork is a must if you wanna keep that hunk of junk in the sky making you only as strong as your weakest link. The online community is rather great when it comes to this concept, and most of them have mics so you can still have quite a bit of fun, even if your friends don't seem to be all that interested in joining you for some co-op aerial combat goodness.The ships all handle relatively smoothly, and offer a difference that makes each one feel just a slight bit varried. Wether you're using the Squid for hit and run tactics, the Pyramidion for those that like to get in close, stay close, then ram the opponent as a final insult to injury, or the Galleon. A massive warship built to tank, and give as good as it can get to any of those more fragile ships. The guns your ship comes equipped for the most part feel right, the majority of which are projectile based and not hit-scan. Projectiles meaning of course they have to travel through the air and are effected by your ship as it sways and turns, and hit-scan meaning it deals damage instantly as soon as you click on an enemy ship. The only gun I've noticed some hickups with is the flare which never seems to want to go anywhere near the target at mid range no matter how you aim it.The game has a few weird hangups. Namely the push to talk lag for anyone using a laptop to play, some latency issues which aren't a major problem since the game isn't an fps, and an occasional weird glitch or bug where you might just suddenly fall off the ship, or not be piloting it. Thankfully the bugs aren't frequent enough to be a real bother.If you're looking for a multiplayer experience that thrives on communication, have a hankering for some aerial combat, and can look past a few of the rough edges you'll be in for a good time.

Posted: December 22, 2014
												Easily one of the greatest games of the decade.The basic idea of the game is you and three others are the crew of an airship in a steampunk-ish setting. You get together with one or two other airships, and you get into a huge fight in the skies with a different group of two or three airships. What GoIO does really well though is the teamwork part of the crew: you have three different classes - the Pilot, who flies the airship around, the Gunner, who gets on the guns and shoots at the other airships while they're flying around, and the Engineer, who runs around fixing things and yells at the pilot for letting the other airships break things in the first place.In a pinch, none of the classes are restricted to just their main roles, either, which I really like. The gunner can grab a spanner and fix his own damn gun while the engineer is busy fixing more critical things like the hull and balloon, the engineer can buff various parts of the ship to be more effective or man a gun if he's got nothing else to do, and the pilot can deal some damage by opening the throttle all the way and ramming full speed into the other guys while doing the yell from Immigrant Song in the wrong key. Embracing this versatility can sometimes be the difference between winning the match and exploding while your crew asks you never to do that again.A wide complement of ships and equipment are available. Personally, I pilot a Junker named "Stone Temple", and when I'm on the guns I prefer incendiary rounds, but there's enough equipment for everyone's play style. The character customization is also insanely complex, with the only downside being most of the cosmetics cost money. Fortunately, GoIO adopts a "cosmetics-only" cash shop, and has promised never to sell anything that would actually effect gameplay, so if you don't want to pay any more than base price to play the whole game, you're in luck.In conclusion, I'm convinced this game is a masterpiece. Easily worth $60 for some of the best multiplayer in history, and they're only selling the collector's edition for $20 base price.

Posted: May 13, 2014
												If you are expecting a full-blown MMO that takes place in the skies, this game isn't for you. If however, you would like some 16 player 4 ship multiplayer battles in the sky, in the style of a MOBA, then you will have a blast. The game is very well balanced, and stresses teamwork more than being a good shot/pilot/engineer, which is aided by the team and lobby voice chat built in. This game is a blast, and having gotten the collectors edition with 3 extra copies of the game, I am able to have a full crew of me and 3 friends for just 7.50, thanks to the recent sale. For someone who does not like MOBAs, or FPS's, this game is a blast, and I can already see myself sinking massive numbers of hours into it. 4 stars.2 year edit:Game is still going strong, has regular surges of people everytime it goes on sale, to about 1000-2000 players on at a time, and then drops down to about 250 during the off-sale times. Few recent updates revamped some of the strategies, and balanced out a lot of weapons and loadouts, so no more gatling-moartar pyrimidions blotting out the skies with their sheer numbers. Still would recomend picking up the 4 pack of the game, it's dropped down to 7.25 on at least 6 occasions I can recall. This is a blast to play with friends, and I will keep playing this until star citizen comes out and I can play this with spaceships. 5 stars.
