Posted: November 26, 2013
												For an indie game, this game is DEFINITELY WORTH the asking price! The game takes a bold direction by putting players in flying airships in a fancy steampunk- themed world. Teamwork is essential here, as you and three other players, each playing one of 3 different roles: Gunner, Engineer, and Pilot...must work together in order to ensure a decisive victory over your opponents in the skies! Gameplay is fun, addictive, and well- balanced (for the most part). A fresh change of pace from your typical team- based pvp game. It's just such a shame this game isn't more well- known....Highly recommend playing this game with a group of friends.

Posted: June 21, 2015
												This game is good.The community I believe, is the best part of it; almost all the players are friendly and welcoming. Out of the hundreds of matches I've been in I've only experienced one rather unpleasant individual. The gameplay is incredibly fun, there is a depth to the countless strategies and ways to play the game that are really great. Ship customization allows you to make really interesting builds, you can have a fast sniping ship or a tanky ship with heavy guns. This is one of the few games I always come back to play, it's totally worth it!Pros:+ Fun, intense gameplay+ Incredibly friendly community+ Countless ways to play and strategize+ Great visuals+ Constant new updates + Lots of fun with friendsCons:+ At times can get repetitive+ The matchmaking lobbies drag on forever. A recent update sped it up a bit, but it still takes a good 10-15 minutes to start a match!

Posted: November 30, 2013
												Please, if you're even slightly interested in this game, stick with me to the end.At first, I was turned off of this game. The in-game cosmetic microtransactions in a paid game, and a couple of friends' opinions of it did not sell it for me. But, when another friend of mine gave me the game so that I could crew on his ships, and I gave it another look...I found my new favorite game.The developers have put in a lot of time, effort, and love into their creation and their community. They're quite involved with the people that play their game, and many if not all of them play their game every chance they get, twice a week.The in-game cosmetic store, let me say, is optional. Nothing you buy will affect your gameplay...AND, any piece in the store can be earned for free in dev matches, hosted Tuesdays and Thursdays, if you're feeling particularly frugal.About the game itself, think of it as "3D naval battles" against other teams of people. Each crew of four works together to man a ship, which is chosen by the captain. Each ship flies differently, and uses different tactics and strategies to be effective. The most important aspects to winning this game are, in my opinion, communication, morale, and teamwork, in that order. Everything else is gravy.Guns of Icarus: Online is seriously underrated, and I hope that everyone gives it a chance. But I must say, it's even better if you have someone to fly with. Bring a friend or two, and you won't regret it!

Posted: November 26, 2013
												I would compare the way this game plays to TF2, but it's so much more than that--it requires absolute teamwork to get anything done (for better or for worse).When I have a good team, this game fits into some of the most satisfying experiences I've ever had in gaming.  When I have a bad team, the frustration doesn't last long at all (due to the forgiving nature of the game).  Deaths are over in an instant, and ships respawn so you can get right back into the action.Every action in the game seems fair, and ships/items that didn't seem fair have since been patched.  The developers of this game are following TF2's footsteps in their development model.If you have the money, and the time, this game is a good gamble. You'll need a few friends, but it's worth the effort to get everyone organized into a team.I'd give it an 8/10.

Posted: November 25, 2013
												GoIO is quite the unique game, with a mostly fantastic community, and an always active and open Dev team. the game is deceptivly simple at first, but as you play you realise how deep and teamwork oriented everything is. i also love that the game caters to pretty much every possible play style in a ship to ship combat game, want to rush in and ram things to splinters? you can do it, want to run in, pop a ballon or set some fires and run away to safety? check, want to play it safe and snipe from across the map, you can do that too. you can even just launch a bunch of mines and try to trick the enemy into flying into them. anything and everything can be effective as long as you have good teamwork, and with a surprisingly civil community thats not a problem.

Posted: June 25, 2014
												This is one of the most lovingly well-crafted games I have ever seen. There is something about the way that the developers balance all of the components, from time-management, to customization, to sheer fighting force, that it creates an environment which fosters amazing teamwork and sportsmanship. In addition, it also makes for the nicest community of any game I've played.Graphics 9/10While the graphics aren't quite as photo-realistic as some of the big name games out there (CoD, Halo, etc…) they are beautifully crafted, and present a rough and rugged steampunk setting. The ships themselves are detailed and full of moving parts, which serve as a reminder that you aren't on just some video-game ship, but a real piece of machinery. The landscapes, too, are stunning, and though up close, the textures are slightly lacking, when you are mid air, it makes for some amazing vistas. The combination of sublime natural beauty and post-apocalyptic destruction is successful. In particular, I am fond of the WWII era battleship half-sunk in the sand of Battle on the Dunes, and the wreckage of an airship skeleton on Duel at Dawn.Story 8/10 (tentative)Well, since there isn't a real storyline as of yet, this rating is a little based on potential I see, but from the meta-game material I've seen, the introductions shown on each map, and the imminent advent of adventure mode, I am very excited for how the story will develop. From the hints, though, things are looking pretty cool.Music 8/10The music in this game is well-crafted, if not quite as creative or actual-music-y as the soundtrack of Bastion, per se, but what they do have, is a soundtrack that modulates based on play. When you spawn, there is no music, but as you near other ships, ominous drums begin to play, followed by flutes playing war cries, then more and more of the orchestra come in as the battle intensifies. This lends a great tension to the game, and makes for a very satisfying battle experience.Gameplay 10/10There is nothing that I can really fault the gameplay for at large. Sometimes glitches creep in, but the devs are very good about fixing them. In terms of genre, it's hard to say where to place this. It really depends on your class. There are three classes: The Pilot, The Engineer, and The Gunner. When you are playing with the pilot, the game plays like a dogfighter, only a little slower, since you're flying a ship rather than a plane (Though planes are in the works, apparently). This is not to say that it is boring. On the contrary, the 3D movement is very fluid, and competent captains can pull off some pretty amazing moves. Also, there are a variety of piloting tools to allow your ship to perform better. As engineer, you are playing a time management game, combined with a bit of fps, and a bit of parkour. You have to keep all the components repaired, but also might need to do daring jumps around the ship to get to them fast enough. Instead of boring time-management, though, there is always a great deal of excitement as the engineer, since the tension of the battle spices things up, and you need to negotiate with your crew. As Gunner, you're playing a turret-based fps, with some time management. The guns are very satisfying, and aiming is a good challenge, especially with arcing mortars or sniper rifles. However, where this game really shines is the crew and team cooperation. The captain commands his crew, but the crew also has to negotiate themselves and make sure that the ship is in tip-top shape (and the enemies aren't). Quite often, there is a quick friendship formed between the crew and captain, and a banter on the ship is not uncommon. Furthermore, there is another layer of teamwork as the captain must team up with the other ships on his team. The voice chat is very smooth, and it is highly recommended, since communication is critical.Community 10/10The learning curve on this game is a little steep, but luckily (unless you fail to communicate at all), you will be helped out by higher level players. Most level 15's are happy to play with level 1's and will give them commands to help them learn. It's very rare that you meet a troll, and the community usually snuffs them out with the power of friendship and love. The lobbies are usually lively, and conversations between games are usually off-topic and fun. However, people who want to play seriously will do so, but still with a sense of fun. Furthermore, there are frequent tournaments and player hosted events like ship racing. One of the best parts, however, is the dev involvement. There are devs on almost every day, and most players have a chance to play with them. When you send an email, they respond within hours, usually, and will not hesitate to post in every steam discussion. Balance 10/10This game is not pay-to-win, which is awesome. You can buy things, but they are only cosmetic, and very cheap, so nobody is ever ahead by money. Better still, when you level, you don't unlock new weapons, which would give high level players an even higher advantage. You do unlock cool costumes, and badges, though, which is more than fair compensation. All of the ships are equal, and nothing is really OP in the game, so really, the team with the best strategy and teamwork wins, not the higher level players with more money.Overall 10/10The reviews gave this game a bad rep, because of its glitchiness in the beta. DO NOT BELIEVE METACRITIC. Those are early reviews of and early version. If the reviews reflected the current version, they would be far higher. Honestly, I think this is a game for everybody. Get it while it's on sale if you can, but it's well worth the $15. It's definitely better with friends, though, so if you can, get a 4-pack and play with your friends as crew. There is no reason for this not to be the top team-based game in the world. Buy it now, and make the awesome community even awesomer.

Posted: October 25, 2015
												Guns of Icarus has a very unique concept. And the execution is nearly perfectlyYou got 4 guys per ship doing different things. (Usually 1 Pilot, 2 People using the Guns and 1 person focused on repairing.) The Persons themself are unkilable, only the ship is.There are 3 Game Modes: Team Deathmatch, King of the Hill and Crazy King.Then there are 3 classes to choose from. Each of em has it´s own purpose with it´s own tools.But the by far most important and most positive aspect of this Game is the community!!!This community is the direct opposite to CoD or CS:GO.It is really small with only around 400 (getting up to 6000 players during sales)  people at a time, but thats a good thing and this Game is definitely NOT DEAD.You start recognizing people, make friends really quickly and learn the baiscs and advanced stuff pretty fast.U can customize a lot of stuff in this game. Your look (cosmetics available through microtransactions, but no benefitial stuff), Your Ship, the Guns u have on it, what ammo u wanna use for em, you can pick stuff like kerosine to fly faster or a chute vent to decrease altitude really quickly as a pilot.This game is really atmospheric aswell. You got all sorts of Maps from dunes to ruined cities to snowy mountains and a frozen ocean. The music is awesome and really fitting.The combat is good aswell. You have different guns all made for different parts of the ship. U have a Gatling Gun t shred through the opponents armor, Flamethrowers to light things up, Carronades to destroy a ship´s Balloon. Or heavy guns like Flaks and Hwachas. Destroying a certain part of the ship has a certain effect. If your engines are destroyed you will have a hard time moving, if the Balloon is down you will descent until you hit the ground and die eventually.All of that stuff can be repaired again though.It is not everybodys Game though. Everybody cares his package and has his job. If you dont do it correctly chances are your ship wont get a single kill. The Engineers have to react quickly on broken parts, the Gunners should be percise and the Pilot should´nt hit every mountain on the map. Communication is key. If you see a ship, call it. If a part is destroyed, call it. If u need the guns armed at the port or starboard side, call it.A bad thing could be that because of the close-knitted community and the age of this game, there aren´t any Lobbies for new players. Before you reach level 8 with any class you will be able to play in so called novice matches. But there aren´t any so expect to get torn apart at your first game. But I would be suprised if your crew would be mad at you. Usually they are nice folks who will stay friendly and teach you a couple of things like what equipment is better or what ammo you should use for what gun.Another really awesome thing is the touch between the community and the developers. They join public matches, do Streams to talk to the players and even support events from bigger clans like the weekly Iron Fork from the Cake Clanon Fridays. They also do dev games where you can play against them and if you win you will get an Item for free.They are still actively supporting the game with patches, fixes and even an upcoming coop story mode, which sounds like it will have some unique concepts.Some people say that they quitted GoI because of a patch released some time ago. I bought this game after said patch and cannot make a statement about if it became worse or not. All I can say is that this Game is probably one of the best coop games out there and that you are missing out something if you dont give this game at least a shot.If I had to rate it I would give it a 9/10, probably a 10/10 as soon as the coop mode comes out. This game can be confusing for beginners, but as long as you communicate and you are willing to learn there should be nothing that can stop you and your crew from conquering the skies.

Posted: May 24, 2014
												Alright, so for my review.I am going to start with the visuals.So I am going to say that the ships themselves look really good. The textures for the walls, balloons, and guns and everything are really pretty nice. It has a very fun look to it. Sadly, look past the ship and be ready to see what apear to be giant mounds of fecal matter surrounded by gasios fog. The rocks, walls, buildings, and everything past your ship and other peoples ships look really lack luster, and it is really distracting from the otherwise nice apeal in of the ship.So now onto the actual gameplay.I am going to say this game is super fun to play. Like great fun. People over the voice chat are friendly and helpfull, the shooting mechanics are good, the controlls are snappy, it has a great mix of shooting, defense, and repairs and it is actually quite fun to jump around the airship fixing things and firing back at the enemy. While the in game transactions are a little anoying for a game that I payed for, they are mostly cosmetic and have little to no effect on the actual gameplay. The best in my opinion is the team death match, where you have two airships on your team and the equal amount on the other team, and you stratagise and team up to kill each other. It is great, and it can get really intense at some points. The best part of this game is when you get a group of friends on the same boat, and you can voice chat and stuff to comunicate enemy positions and directions. I have one gripe about the gameplay though.... And that is, a few of my friends on lower end rigs had some issues with clipping and some bad lag. This should not be the case with a meh looking game written in the unity engine.Difficulty: A lot of people in their reviews have pointed out that there can be a small learning curve when you first enter the game. I would agree with this, but I would also say that it is still fun when you are learning and it does not take long to get working like a well oilded machine.Overall, I would say this game is a load of fun if you can look past some poor textures and some poorly optimised gameplay. thesupergeek rates this a 12/10 for fun and a 8/10 for graphics. I will most likely play much more of this game over the summer.

Posted: June 7, 2016
												Summary:What is it that makes this game so special? Sometimes I ask myself why I can lose myself in a game with actually very little content, very little customization, and non-groundbreaking gameplay. It's simple, really. Community.Pros:1. Runs on almost anything at high graphics.2. Welcoming community3. Kind developers4. Easy to learn yet competitiveCons:1. Graphics are a little outdated compared to newer titles2. Advancement in the game is painfully slow with little reward for hours of playtime3. Some ships and weapons feel unbalanced4. Small playerbase5. Insanely long que timesComponents:Graphics - 6Sound - 7Gameplay - 4Community - 10Development - 8Full Review:Steampunk is my guilty pleasure, so I won't lie, I loved the asthetic of this game from hour one. I felt like a real part of a crew, with experienced captains micro-managing my job and showing me the ropes. I was quickly hooked. What really blew my mind was the atmosphere of community. Part of this might be from the casual nature of the game -- it has no ranked or competitive mode and a VERY slowly scaling level system for each class. Most players are long-time high-level characters who just play the game because it is fun for them. This creates a refreshing atmosphere where a new player can be taught the ropes and old players make friends over the in-game voice system. What is really strange for me is that I've met only 4 players in 20 HOURS of gametime that were flamers. One of these players gave a long-winded speech about how terrible his captain was, and kind players simply told him he was stupid and left the lobby.Apart from the community, however, the gameplay becomes stale very quickly. After you've reached a certain level on each class, you run out of new ideas. Each game is the same -- load a certain ammo into a certain gun, shoot things, hit things, and steer things. Graphically, the game doesn't have too much to offer either, but for a Unity-based game, it's pretty impressive. It feels like a steamworld, but looks more minimalistic than a tripleA game. The soundscape is fairly mediocre, but I still feel a surge of happiness when I hear the title song.Conclusion:All in all, this game caters to a certain kind of person. If you want to be the best at a game or manage character sheets and beat the crap out of someone, don't play this. If you have a considerable amount of time on your hands and want a casual friend-making experience, this is the game for you.

Posted: October 2, 2015
												You're looking at this game. You're looking at this review. Let me not waste your time.We, as gamers, play games for fun; for the reward of victory or actions well executed. In Guns of Icarus, you play as part of a group of four on an airship. You are in charge of your position and generally only your position so victory is determined by the cohesion and experience of the crew as a whole. Here's a (kind of) TLDR on that:Roles in hypothetical order of importance:-Captain: The pilot of the ship. He steers, pivots, raises and lowers the airship to best attack and defend enemy airships. He gets to choose three abilities from a stack of eight to increase the speed, turning, ascent/descent, etc. The Captain also chooses the guns for his ship and therefore decides the general tactics for disabling and destroying the enemy. -Main Engineer: The repairman. When individual parts of the ship take damage, which they will to great extent whether you like it or not, it is the Main Engineer's duty to repair the vital components, mainly the hull armor and the engines. When a component is destroyed, it no longer functions, so a ship without its engines, for example, can not move forward or turn and only keeps its existing momentum and turn angle until those components are repaired. Many ships have fallen by ramming into buildings and mountains because of this. Survival is often hinged upon the Main Engineer and his ability to delegate repairs and sprint between components.-Gunner: The shooter. Every role gets to choose their own ammo type for use with the guns, even the Captain. The Gunner, however, gets to pick three out of a selection of eight to load their weapons with. Each ammo type has a different effect: Burst gives more ammo and AoE damage, Incendiary increases chance to cause fires, Greased increases ammo and firing speed, Heatsink increases ammo and prevents flames from disabling the gun. Each ammo type is unique and it is the Gunner's duty to know the guns, know the ammo and deliver the most debilitating blow with each bullet (or rocket) fired. Being able to switch between three ammo types helps by changing the effectiveness of your weapon in battle. -Secondary Engineer: The handyman. Stuck between a side-gunner and a side-engineer, the Secondary Engineer repairs the components that the Main Engineer cannot effectively handle. This usually includes the balloon, the guns and often an engine or two. Additionally they fire the guns more than they repair and are an important part of the overall damage of the ship. Sometimes equipped with a buff hammer to increase their damage output, Secondary Engineers are also called Gungineers or Gun Engies due to their assistance with the destruction of enemy ships.What's great about this game is the victory and conquest of a defeated fleet, of barely getting out of a fire fight with minimal health only to turn around and destroy the attacking ship. It is exhilirating in a way that is hard to come by in other co-operative games. Pros/Cons:+ Airship design is wicked. Beautiful, beautiful, beautiful. Good amount of subtle details and touches to increase ambiance. - You will die a lot. Practice mode is necessary for first time players. The learning curve is harsh as there is little time for error and crewmates may berate you (as you may eventually do to them) for failing at your post.+ When you learn your post and your ships, the game becomes infinitely more enjoyable. Single-handedly delivering victory to your ship as a Main Engineer because you know the guns and how to disable the enemy ship with them is like executing a Fatality in Mortal Kombat. It. Just. Feels. Good.- You will hear harsh words or be talked down to. That's to be expected of pretty much all multiplayer games that include voice chat though. The negative interactions come from a place of personal investment in the game so, you know, take it in stride.+ You will make a friend or two and have a few laughs with others in the "side game" known as Lobbies Of Icarus where we wait for the match to start. It's a fun community and we do enjoy it. -/+ Takes about 100-200 matches, generally speaking, to get good at your role. Not sure whether that's good or bad but it takes some understanding. If a game can be picked up and mastered in 10 matches, then it's boring. If a game takes a 1000, then it may be too challenging. This pops somewhere in between and I became good at every role after about 400 matches. I became really good at Main Engineering after about 550. Now I'm at 700 matches and can be lethal in any role on any ship.In closing, I used to be in the Navy and it really does draw a pretty good parallel to the camraderie and the scrambling frenzy of working with a crew on a small ship. In real life if a major pipe bursts you may only have minutes before the entire ship is lost. The game brings back the mad dash of repair work and maintenance while adding guns and a steampunk element to everything. 288 hours on record and I'm not going to stop playing this game. It's just that fun.10/10

												+++++-Great game to play with friends if you have 3+ to have playsessions,-Looks pretty good and runs smooth on my average pc.-Huge amount of achievements for the explorers under you.-Several interesting ships to board-Easy to understand yet hard to master-Customisation-The games take a rather long time(comparable to a Dota or LoL game)--------If you don't have friends to play with and you are not highly into that whole steampunk themethen you may want to wait for some friends to buy this one:Long waiting times due to a low playerbase of 100-300 at the moment [End of 2015].There are no penalties for going afk or leaving from what I've seen.In most games I or the enemy team finds themselves left alone on a ship once filled with 4 real people (now one player and 3 AI).The AI doesn't seem to be able to pilot the ship thus more often then not you will eventually have to take on the role of the steering pilot of an abandoned ship.In the few games I've played there was even a case where a whole ship simply surrendered (2v2 fight) thus leaving one team in an unwinnable 1v2 scenario.The game contains some small micro transactions, it's not being forced upon you though.+-The community seems to be rather nice in voice chat (given the 40% that are usually left after the game ends)It contains a rather big number of little kids, so muting them will come in handy to you at some point.===> Personally I'd not recommend buying this being as a single person. Posted: June 15, 2015
												Guns of Icarus Online is a game like no other, and here's why: This game is about commanding an "airship" through the skies of a variety of beautiful maps while alongside your crewmates. There are 3 classes to chose from: Pilot, Engineer, and Gunner, each with their own jobs, but can also help out around the ship with other things. Depending on the ship you chose to bring to battle, some classes are more important than others. The ships can be customized to your liking and there are plenty to chose from. Each ship has 4 people on board. The main game type is a battle between two teams, each with 2 or 3 ships. There is something about the experience of joining your friends and commanding your own ship, flying into battle, and destroying other players that feels so amazing and surreal. And I'm not overexaggerating, this game is pure fun if you have a few friends with you. The battles can be really intense and yet so rewarding in the end. You can also customize your character for each class and what tools they bring with them to battle. I definitely reccomend this game if you have a few friends who also have it. And if they don't have it, suggest it to them.

Posted: December 25, 2015
												+++++-Great game to play with friends if you have 3+ to have playsessions,-Looks pretty good and runs smooth on my average pc.-Huge amount of achievements for the explorers under you.-Several interesting ships to board-Easy to understand yet hard to master-Customisation-The games take a rather long time(comparable to a Dota or LoL game)--------If you don't have friends to play with and you are not highly into that whole steampunk themethen you may want to wait for some friends to buy this one:Long waiting times due to a low playerbase of 100-300 at the moment [End of 2015].There are no penalties for going afk or leaving from what I've seen.In most games I or the enemy team finds themselves left alone on a ship once filled with 4 real people (now one player and 3 AI).The AI doesn't seem to be able to pilot the ship thus more often then not you will eventually have to take on the role of the steering pilot of an abandoned ship.In the few games I've played there was even a case where a whole ship simply surrendered (2v2 fight) thus leaving one team in an unwinnable 1v2 scenario.The game contains some small micro transactions, it's not being forced upon you though.+-The community seems to be rather nice in voice chat (given the 40% that are usually left after the game ends)It contains a rather big number of little kids, so muting them will come in handy to you at some point.===> Personally I'd not recommend buying this being as a single person.          It might be worth checking out when it goes into sale so you'll gain a few hours of fun without regrets.          In case you have friends to play this with I can highly recommend this game to you as most annoying problems                                                       (leaving players/too few players/communication problems) vanish.See you on the battlefield /

Posted: February 14, 2016
												Guns of Icarus is probably one of the most rewarding team-based games I have ever played, but it is not without its flaws.The good:+All 3 classes are distinct and you need a healthy mix in order to play well.+Both the ships and guns all play rather differently, but mastering them all feels great.+The maps have a nice variety to them and feature both cover, sandstorms and open ground.+All in-game items for sale are purely cosmetic and you can even unlock some as you play.+Almost every victory feels rewarding as it requires a lot from the entire team.The bad:-The soundtrack is rather limited, although judging from the dev updates that might change soon.-Communication is key, so if you or your team members don't have a mic and refuse to talk - you'll lose.-The game is currently multiplayer only, so wait times can be rather long before finding a match.Bottom Line:Guns of Icarus is an absolutely fantastic niche title that mixes steampunk, co-op ship management and even arena combat to make for a great experience. However, I would recommend picking up the 4-pack so you have friends to play with as going in completely alone can lead to a poor experience.

Posted: January 13, 2013
												Guns of icarus is a team based game where in you fly a zeppelin with your crew consisting of four people with three roles to choose from, Pilot, Engineer, and Gunner. Choose your ship, your guns, your equipment and duke it out in 2v2 team death matches.This game is extremly original with the exception of one other game similiar to it. It focuses very hard on competitive team play and has a slightly high learning curve.The only downfall this game really has is that you can buy cosmetic items in a real currency cash shop to deck out your player in cool clothes, even though they are strictly cosmetic and no effect on gameplay whatsoever they are slightly on the expensive side and the fact you have to pay for the game and you still see a microtransaction shop leaves a sour taste in the mouth.But overall guns of icarus is a fantastic game especially if you and your friends are looking for a great team based game to play with each other. Solid 8/10

Posted: February 8, 2016
												Some of you will probably be on the fence about buying this game; well, if one strager's opinion is enough to push you to the right choice, then take mine. This game of high caliber, if you enjoy team-based conflict with a complex network of support, and its graphics are quite nice. There are many maps to play on, and even a practice map for people looking to organize themselves or test their flying prowess. If you didn't figure out already, Guns of Icarus is about teams of 2-4 airships with crews of 4 fighting to the death in midair. The game is set in a steampunk-like world, and the three classes, engineer, gunner and pilot must work together, along with other tam ships to destroy the other team and keep their ship alive. So if that's your thing, this is the game for you. Unless you don't have friends. This game is way more fun with friends in a skype call. Good Graphics- +2Steampunk- +1Hard to play without friends- -26-directional movement- +2Multiple customizable airships- +1Hours of fun- +1Fun to play with friends- +38/10 Play all the time. But not without friends.

Posted: June 22, 2015
												This game is a hidden gem. If you have friends to play with (preferrably in a LAN setting) then you should get this game. It takes cooperative, strategical teamwork in video games to a whole new level. Each role that you play feels distinct and makes you feel like you are directly contributing to the success or failure of your ship. PROS:- Distinctly different roles to play- Genuine feel of teamwork- Many customizable options available for your character and ships- Good tutorials and a rank system that help you build skill before jumping into matches with experienced players.- Very nice in-game communication tools if you don't like using a mic.CONS:- Graphics aren't the best- Community is relatively small- Having one or two bad players on a crew can ruin the experience for everyone- No single player options or players vs AI options

Posted: December 9, 2013
												I can't think of another co-operatively multiplayer game that has made me jump out of my seat and whoop for joy upon defeating an opponent.When your crew comes together and collectively out-manoeuvres, out-guns, and generally out-performs a rival crew, pummelling a hostile ship to pieces with co-ordinated effort and avoiding the worst that the enemy can throw back at you...The feeling you experience at that moment is what draws you back into the skies.I have piloted my ship through a passing cloud, hiding in ambush as an enemy ship approaches unawares. With a heavy carronade I have harried opponent engineers, pressuring them to keep their balloon functional as the rest of their dirigible degrades around them. And with swift reactions I have wrestled the fate of my ship and crew from the enemy's hands by repairing, maintaining, and empowering onboard systems and weapons to deny victory to my opponents.Gather a crew and take to the skies! You won't regret it.

Posted: March 31, 2016
												My friend bought this to me and I did not really know what to expect from it. I strated it up and heard the most amazing soundtrack I have ever heard in a game before. The first thing you do is to pick a name (like any other game). I recomend to pick something you can role play around, this game´s community is really good a at that (The community is really good at most things). I picked Captain Kirk.The gameplay is actually really simple. You and your crew are on a airship and will try to shoot down the enemies airship. It sounds simple and it is simple. But when you get to the higher levels there is alot more strategy involved. The gameplay have a really good depth, simple in the beginning but there is still alot to learn and master.The best part of the game must be the community that plays it. They are all very helpfull towards new players. Some of the best moments I have experiences I have had in the game is when you are just cruising the skies searching for enemies. I stand there at the helm shouting meaningless orders to the crew to ready the warp engines and to charge the ion torpedoes and they answer with the same roleplay. Or that one time we found a tomato plant on the ship and we just stood there discussing it´s backstory. The game is full with those moments.I highly recommend that you and a few friends buy this game (if you don´t have friends there is no need to worry, you can easily find some in the game). Just make sure you have a mic, the voice-chat is half of the experience in my opinion.

												I had a strange bucket-list:* - Hear a Turkish man yell "All hands on deck!".* - Hear more than three grown men and women quack fiercely.* - See an entire crew jump ship because the captain is drunk.* - Be compared to the captain of the Titanic.* - Turn on toxic "allies", being spared by the other team.* - Listen to The Tractor Song on repeat.    * - Hear peope sing along.All this, and more, has happened to me in-game.The coordination and cooperation this game inspires is unmatched. The game looks (and kind of is) aged, but is nonetheless a breath of fresh air from everything wrong with any other game, ever.Not convinced yet? This game is well worth the price, discounted or not. I actually feel bad for having bought this during a sale, so I've decided to buy cosmetic in-game items as compensation. And before anybody rants about in-game stores in paid-for games; it's fair. Everything is decently priced and the game itself is far too cheap not to have it.

Posted: March 21, 2016
												  I really want to recommended this game, you will never worry about nobody played this game. It is very interesting and one of the best steam punk game ever! Very exciting!  Graphic is good. You can even fell the cloud, fog and wind by the environment. That game has paid a lot of attention on the details, every thing from the bloon in ship to the decorate in clothes with the steampunk style.  For the audio, there have a very good back ground music, just like steampunk, gommy but hopeful. The voices of charcator also suprised me, except the genders, there has not only some ENG pronounce with different tone, but also Japanese and Russian.  It has a very unique game play. I never seen or thought that kind of game have Mutiplay, it need too much teamwork, sure it does. There has three charactors, it is easy to start it, you might think that just few buttons problem, NO, it is much complicated, you will never win a game like that. All members are human, each person in the crew need to do they part or even the others' part. As a captain you need to run the whole ship as one, mostly that job taken by the polit, but it is much more than that. You need really become a leader, your leadership is very important, you can't fire a machine gun with your polit skills, who will? your crew will, as a captain you need both polit skills and leadership to lead a ship or a fleet.   Those are just few of the most interesting part of this game, there has much more you will enjoy.

Posted: February 20
												A very fun and thrilling game indeed. I don't think I've ever had such a rush of adredaline from repairing something quite like Guns of Icarus. It feels unique mostly due to it's obvious "Steampunk" atmostphere. Not many games use this style, but the crew behind Guns of Icarus have done well in making this old school sci-fi work well with the game's mechanics and other features. As for the ship combat, I was, and still continue to be impressed with how well optimized the combat is. In order to succeed in this game, you HAVE to know the benefits and limitations of your chosen airship in order to have maximum chances of victory, let alone survival. The ability to customize loadouts and turrets is also handy. You can have anything from a super heavy assault platform to a small zippy scout ship. Being able to do anything, also means you have to be prepared for anything.Though, I hate to say it, but there is one massive downside to playing this game. And that is the lack of players. The last time I played ( a couple of days before I wrote this review). There were only 180 players online in my area. It's not the case of a dead game, but a dead playerbase. And I hate to see such an awesome game endure a lack of customers.So, if you have some cash. And you're looking for something fun to sink some time into, I would most definitely reccomend this game. And if you do make the purchase. Tell your friends, because Guns of Icarus needs as many people as it can get.

Posted: February 13, 2014
												Guns of Icarus Online is an absolutely spectacular game, certainly worth the price (especially if you and three friends all pool your money and get the 4-pack). Given that ship crews are four people strong (captain, engineer and two gunners in my group) this works out well.For an online-only game, and in absolute terms, the community is fantastic - never once have I encountered a rude player and novices actually get a chance to learn the game rather than be bullied out by the more-experienced players (looking at you, LoL).Feature-wise, the game is very dependant on teamwork, no single ship is overpowered and there are many different weapon loadouts for each given ship, making spotting and target identification a must-have skill. Each player can take five items of equipment (one sailing tool, one engineering tool, one gunnery tool; plus two extras for their chosen class), which allows for even more customisation in fighting style. The levelling system is strange but it works - achievements count towards levels, with so many achievements being needed to level up. Crucially for an online-only game, there is absolutely no pay-to-win.The game looks amazing, there's no doubt about that. Everything is beautifully rendered and designed. The soundtrack and in-game SFX are also incredible.The only downside I can think of is that if the game lags, it can have a severe impact on the entire crew's effectiveness, especially if the Captain is the one with the lag issues.

Posted: November 27, 2013
												Guns of Icarus Online is a refreshingly unique experience that deserves some attention. The game plays out by pitting several 4-player crews against each other in team-based airship battles. Every member of the crew has a role to fill and your success or failure depends entirely on you crews ability to function as a cohesive unit. Engineers will repair the damage your ship takes in combat, pilots fly the ship and are responsible for lining up shots, and gunners keep the pressure on the enemy. There is a good variety of ships to choose from each with their own strengths and weaknesses, and a multitude of weapons which can be slotted in different locations on the ship. Creating the right ship build with the right crew consistently yeilds a satisfying result. That said a twitch shooter this is not. The weapons are slow to fire and slower to reload, coordination is everything and there is absolutely no room for lone wolf tactics in this game. If you are looking for a game that rewards patience and teamwork look no further, pick up the 4-pack and invite some friends. If you feel like giving the devs a little more support there is an in-game cash shop as well but it only contains cosmetic items. Character unlocks are purely cosmetic as well meaning no player will be at a competitive disadvantage, save for tackling the games initial learning curve. I have been very happy with the game's balance thus far with the one exception that the random spawn locations during objective based matches can be wildly unfair (and that too many players fly the noobie Pyramideon and Goldfish ships but thats just a personal gripe). The community as a whole has been very helpfull and fun to interact with and the developers have made it clear that there are big things in store for the future of the game. This game could have easily been a pay-to-win copy & paste frag fest but instead the developers made something truely special. If it wasn't clear already I highly recommend this game and hope to see you in the skies.

												This game is great! It is kind of like a real-time version of FTL with movement, in which you control an individual crew member. I do wish that there were more ships and maps though, but the ones that do exist are great. Each map is made in a pretty unique way which emphasizes certain mechanics, and each ship has a niche to fill on the playing field which still allows for plenty of creativity.The overall polish of the game is decent - it's a bit buggy in some places and the graphics are not AAA quality, but the gameplay makes up for it completely.

content:
Posted: May 26, 2015
												Guns of Icarus: Online is an outstanding production. The game offers a very unique, fast paced, strategic gameplay in which your teamwork will be the main factors between victory and defeat. The players will undergo 3 different roles, a captain, a gunner and an engineer, each one of them is vital for the overall victory of the team. The captain will find themselves in the most strategy infused position, it is his/her main responsibility to asses the battlefield and order the crew around in order to ensure that the ship remains in a working condition, at the same time, being able to destroy its opponents. The gunners and the engineers will have to co-operate with the captain, repairing the vitals of the ship and shooting the weaker spots of enemy ships visible in the sky. While this is an unforgettable experience, not popular among the gaming scene, there are minor issues within the game. One of these would definitely be the frustration that comes from bad teammates not doing what they are told or being too slow at realizing the damage on the ship. Another set back for the game could be the pretty stale environments with only a few maps to choose from, each with predictable and limited hazards that, while give a challenge, can be found boring rather easily. Lastly, if you are expecting huge ships and massive crews, you are out of luck as the game only offers smaller ships among its decent variety of vessels and crews of 4 people. This might be a set back however, it also allows for easier management and less chances of being lost among a crows of crew members on your ship.Overall it is a great game with several strong features making it unique and fun, while customization can be called lackluster and a bad crew can cause a loss, there is no arguing over the amount of fun that there is to be had within the game. I would recommend getting the 4-pack and give 3 copied out to friends who would like to play with you to create the optimum crew and maximize the fun with the game. Regardless, its a game worth giving a look, especially on sale prices steam is so famous for ^^

Posted: May 15, 2016
												This game is fantastic.  You're driving boats in the sky with guns trying to murder other boats in the sky with guns.  Stuff catches fire and you get to spray stuff on it to put the fire out.  Stuff breaks and you just hit it with a hammer until it works again.  Within a minute of the match starting your crew becomes family and you just want to hammer the balloon, engines, and guns long enough, hard enough, and fast enough to keep your family from dying.  10/10 would hit everything with a hammer to fix it and fire machine guns all day, every day.

Posted: February 19, 2014
												In Guns of Icarus Online, you can setup a squad of 4 players and drive a Steampunk airship into battle.  The graphics in this game are amazing and when you fly around in a pretty environment the game looks amazing.  There are 3 different classes.  The first one being the gunner, obviously shooting at the other ships.  There is more to the gunner than just blowing ammo into the other ships.  You have different turrets and types of ammo you can cycle through and you also have to calculate projectile drop and damage based on the velocity of the shot.  The next role being engineer, which you have to repair the engines and turrets.  The engineers also have to put out fires on the ship and keep all of the systems working.  The next role is the pilot.  The pilot has to manuever the ship and stay away from danger.  There are many obstacles in the map.  You also have to make sure all of the gunners have a clear shot at the enemy planes while at the same time avoiding dust clouds that damage your plane.  Overall the game is great and worth every penny.  I picked it up during the sale in which it was 75% off so it was only $3.74.  I would say it is still worth it at it's original price.  To succeed in this game, you must use teamwork and cooperation to take down other ships.10/10

Posted: December 18, 2013
												Buy four copies, give them to everyone you know. I'm a huge steampunk fan and I can honestly say I've never seen a game with the scope of Guns of Icarus Online. That being said, when I first saw the game listed on steam I was more than hesitant to pick it up. The idea of being bound to an airship was an initial turn off for me and I didn't know what the community would be like. All the same, I decided to take the plunge and my only regret is not getting it sooner. Guns is easily one of my favorite multiplayer games. You can learn everything you need to play the game in five minutes, though the game is challenging enough that mastery will take a great deal longer.  The three classes in the game are pilot, gunner and engineer. These three classes have a variety of strategies for players to utilize, as well as a ranking system to track progress. I can't begin to recommend the game enough

Posted: June 3, 2014
												This game is great! It is kind of like a real-time version of FTL with movement, in which you control an individual crew member. The roles are all fun to play and each one is important to your crew as a whole. The gameplay is great, requiring a decent amount of planning and multitasking ability to master, and players can develop their own unique styles of play which keeps the game very replayable. I do wish that there were more ships and maps though, but the ones that do exist are great. Each map is made in a pretty unique way which emphasizes certain mechanics, and each ship has a niche to fill on the playing field which still allows for plenty of creativity.The overall polish of the game is decent - it's a bit buggy in some places and the graphics are not AAA quality, but the gameplay makes up for it completely.

REPAIR! REPAIR!!!"As the hours passed. It was time to get off and go to our regular lives, but I knew we were all smiling and thinking the same thing, LET'S ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥UP TOMORROW!

Posted: February 19, 2014
												Guns of Icarus is an amazingly fun Cooperative Airship Battle Arena game. It also has an incredibly friendly and helpful playerbase. That's not to say there isn't the occasional bad egg of a troll, but come on, this is the internet... what did you expect?With dozens of different weapon mounts to cuztomize the variety of different ships, there's definitely a different feel to each captain's playstyle. And every job is important...It's not just the Captain, and everyone else is along for the ride. NO! Everyone has a Job to do, and it's definitely noticable when someone isn't keeping up with theirs.The learning curve is easily taken care of in the tutorials, and any confusion after the fact can be handled in your first few matches by your team. Each class has it's own level, and the leveling system takes some getting used to as winning really doesn't have any positive or negative effect on if you level up or not. It's all about completing tasks/achievements while playing as each individual class. Earn a certain number of them and you level, even if your team loses.All in all, I highly recommend this game for anyone looking for any steampunk fan or fans of cooperative strategy games.
